title.narrative: 703.5 HIV/AIDS (RKLA 5)

description.narrative: Output 703.5 RKLA 5 - Children's Right to be born and remain HIV-free: The RO will advance a programmatic environment in the region that enables achievement of the goals of elimination of HIV transmission to infants (MTCT), keeping their mothers alive and ensuring access to prevention, treatment, care and support for the most vulnerable, socially excluded and HIV affected women, children and adolescents, which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 703. PROGRAMMES: UNICEF contributes to the achievement of the results established in the MTSP and other national and international commitments for children in CEE/CISâ€”in development and humanitarian contextsâ€”with active technical assistance and oversight support from the Regional Office.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 703.5 RKLA 5 - Children?s Right to be born and remain HIV-free: The RO will advance a programmatic environment in theregion that enables achievement of the goals of elimination of HIV transmission to infants (MTCT), keeping their mothers alive andensuring access to prevention, treatment, care and support for the most vulnerable, socially excluded and HIV affected women,children and adolescents
of COs with activities that support national governments and civil society to: develop sustainable services for integrated HIV prevention, including PMTCT for drug dependent women.
of COs with activities that support national governments and civil society to: share knowledge, experience and good practices through horizontal cooperation platforms.
of COs with activities that support national governments and civil society to: develop sustainable services for HIV testing and counselling for adolescent key-affected populations.

of COs with activities that support national governments and civil society to: update national protocols/plans/ strategies/policies on the elimination of new infections in children and keeping their mothers alive, and on prevention and care for most-at-risk/vulnerable adolescents and HIV infected children and adolescents.
